page.title: 10FARMING..CAIRNIE
page.content: The 118 acres cultivated at Cairnie farm are used to grow mostly strawberries and raspberries, barley and vegetables are also grown. The soft fruit is sold by the pound, now only to the public, but occasionally, in the past some was sold to jam- making companies.Strawberries (when sold to these companies) fetch Â£450 per tonne, while raspberries fetch Â£670 per tonne. The farm is run by the Laird family and there are only 3 men employed full time and 2 women employed part time.Each farm worker recieves Â£90 per week (compared to 9 shillings 100 years ago) and a rent-free farm cottage, for the period they work on the farm.
